thread.title: Microsoft Lumia 950: 5.2-inch Quad HD stunning flagship with Windows 10 and 20MP Carl Zeiss camera
thread.title_full: Microsoft Lumia 950: 5.2-inch Quad HD stunning flagship with Windows 10 and 20MP Carl Zeiss camera

author: webmaster@whatech.com.au (Eza Ezamie)
title: Microsoft Lumia 950: 5.2-inch Quad HD stunning flagship with Windows 10 and 20MP Carl Zeiss camera
text:
News from: Eza Ezamie Page views: 72 times What a splendid time that Microsoft is currently having. Its spectacular debut of Windows 10 in July, now it seems that that their smartphones will start to ship with Windows 10 as early as November – and with amazing features to boot. Not one, but two to be exact, Lumia 950 and Lumia 950XL. - Advertisement - 
Windows 10 finally hit the market on July 29 th , seen as a revolution for the PC scene. Now we can foresee that it will have the same positive impact on the smartphone industry with the impending release of Lumia 950 sometime in early November. Seems like the tide is now turning in the favor of Microsoft against the mighty Android and Apple slightly. 
So what is so good about the Lumia 950? In short, it will be featuring high-end features, premium design, and the best Windows 10 experience. Now you can also get the phone to work just like your PC and turn an ordinary moment into your biggest accomplishment. More on that later. 
First things first, the Lumia 950 will be wrapped in a polycarbonate body which makes it look amazing. With a body measurement of 145 x 73.2 x 8.2 mm (5.71 x 2.88 x 0.32 in) and weighs 150 g (5.29 oz), it sure is slim and lightweight. 
The smartphone will be sporting a 5.2-inch Quad HD AMOLED capacitive touchscreen that displays 1440 x 2560 pixels or ~564 ppi pixel density that is simply amazing. There’s also the ClearBlack display being used to ensure the best in terms of color reproduction. To round it all off, there’s the Gorilla Glass 3 for added protection. The screen is scratch-resistant and tough enough to let you relax and enjoy your time with the device. 
Then we can find the Lumia 950 equipped with the latest Qualcomm MSM8992 Snapdragon 808 chipset, a Hexa-core processor comprising of Dual-core 1.82 GHz Cortex-A57 & Quad-core 1.44 GHz Cortex-A53, Adreno 418 graphics and 3GB of RAM. It sure does possess a lot of firepower, and you can be assured of the best when it comes to performance. - Advertisement - 
Camera-wise, the Lumia 950 will be blessed with a 20MP-5MP camera setup. The 20 Megapixel primary camera comes with Carl Zeiss optics and lets you take incredible pictures without having to adjust your settings. It automatically takes sharper images of fast-moving subjects and a triple LED natural flash helps create accurate lighting in darker environments. Rich Capture lets you quickly adjust the color saturation level of bright or dark areas and add or remove the flash in "post." 
With higher resolution and a much improved fast-action capture, 4K video lets you preserve your precious memories in stunning quality. Then there’s the Optical Image Stabilization that comes with a virtually seamless auto focus; this combination will let you take super-sharp and silky-smooth videos. 
By taking lots of high-res photos and 4K videos; something to consider is storage. There should be enough of storage having 32GB of internal storage – to which you can further expand up to a maximum of a whopping 200GB via its microSD slot. 
Next the Lumia 950 will have a Li-Ion 3000 mAh battery supplying juice to it. This should be sufficient enough for a day or two of use in between charging. Fast charging and wireless charging is also there for you to tap into. 
Now we come to the main selling point for the Lumia 950 which is the Windows 10 OS. With Android coming out with Marshmallow 6.0 and Apple with its iOS 9.0, it is about time that Microsoft has a weapon up its sleeve. It has released Windows 10 for the desktop version, and the Lumia 950 will be its first device to be equipped with its mobile version. 
So what is so great about Windows 10? Office apps and Outlook Mail have familiar rich editing tools that scale to fit the screen you’re using, and the brand new Windows Store makes it easy to find apps, music, and videos. And with Cortana for Windows 10, you can use your PC to set a location-based reminder that will arrive just in time on your Lumia. 
Connect your Lumia 950 to a Microsoft Display Dock and use it with an external monitor, a keyboard, and a mouse. Office apps and Outlook scale up to create a big screen-optimized work environment that makes you more productive. It provides users with a PC-like experience that is powered by your phone. A quick and easy way to get the productivity benefits of a mouse and keyboard while leaving your laptop at work and relax knowing that you have a convenient way to get things done. 
Finally, there’s the Windows Hello Beta, which is an incredibly personal and secure way to unlock your Lumia 950. Simply wake up your device, look directly at the screen, and the infra-red camera technology automatically authenticates you. - Advertisement - 
Things are looking up with the impending release of Microsoft Lumia 950. Great design, great features, and a brand new Windows 10 OS accompanying it, you can be sure of a whole new level for flagship devices, and it should elevate its standing in the smartphone industry. To top it all off, there’s the 20 Megapixel Carl Zeiss camera waiting for you. 
The Microsoft Lumia 950 is expected to be released sometime in November 2015 for an estimated price of $549 USD. And for the first time in recent months, it will only be available in Black and White – no vibrant colors like the previous Lumia iterations that we know. News From
